result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Arnold Mcmahon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to: Any other sentence

Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1 year initial confinement
Court approved participation in the Dosage Probation Pilot Program and probation may be terminated early if the defendant successfully complete the program and all other conditions of probation.

miscConds.notes: Pay stipulated amount of $250.00 to be paid to Marlene K.

Defendant ordered to submit to a DNA sample if not already done. Pay all costs, surcharges and restitution, including the mandatory DNA surcharge by the end of probation. If revoked, out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES. If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons. Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION TO BE DETERMINED BY THE DOC's, but to include:
- Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Absolute sobriety.
- Random urine screens. No positive results.
- No illegal drugs.
- No controlled substances without valid prescription.
- No Contact with the victims: Marlene K. and Adam Z.
- Seek/maintain full time employment at the discretion of the probation agent.
- Obtain high school diploma or GED at the discretion of the probation agent.
- Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

timeConds.notes: Huber release privileges for work, school, treatment, the Day Reporting Center. Court does not object to electronic monitoring.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Matthew Arnold Mcmahon in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Matthew Arnold Mcmahon in custody.  James C. Griffin for Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.  State complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 4 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 2 years with credit for 169 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 years.  The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 30 months.

Conditions of Probation/Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:
* As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction.  Huber release privileges for work, school, treatment, the Day Reporting Center.  The Court does not object to electronic monitoring.  
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the victims:  Marlene K. and Adam Z.
*Seek and maintain full time employment at the discretion of the probation agent.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED at the discretion of the probation agent.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Parties stipulated to restitution in the amount of $250.00 to be paid to Marlene K.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Pay all costs ,surcharges and restitution, including the mandatory DNA surcharge by the end of probation. If revoked, out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

- Appeal rights given.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1 year initial confinement.

 Court approved participation in the Dosage Probation Pilot Program and probation may be terminated early if the defendant successfully completes the program and all other conditions of probation.

- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Letter on behalf of the defendant filed.

Defendant Matthew Arnold Mcmahon in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Matthew Arnold Mcmahon in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery for Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court orally amended paragraph 1 in count 1 of the informatoin to read "with the intent to steal"

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1:  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.   

AS TO COUNT 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  Any issues of restitution will be determined at sentencing. Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.   Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court, defendant Matthew Arnold Mcmahon not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM THE HOUSE OF CORRECTION (HOC) FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA HEARING IN BRANCH 26.

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court, Defendant Matthew Arnold Mcmahon not in court, in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant not produced from the House of Correction (HOC) for purposes of this hearing. Defendant referred to the Drug Treatment Court.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court, Defendant Matthew Arnold Mcmahon not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not produced form the House of Correction (HOC) for purposes of this heraing. Defense working on getting Defendant into Drug Treatment Court.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered Defendant turned over to JusticePoint for supervision and drug testing.

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court, defendant Matthew Arnold Mcmahon not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for Lucy Kronforst for the State of Wisconsin.   Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  If in custody, Defendant will not be produced for purposes of the next hearing.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Matthew Arnold Mcmahon in court with Cameron Weitzner for attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Matthew Arnold Mcmahon in custody.  Ron Dague for Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Mark Haase-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Malene K or her residence; Adam Z , 4400 S 13th Street.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Matthew Arnold Mcmahon in court with attorney Jeffry R Schwartz.  
Defendant Matthew Arnold Mcmahon in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
